intro: Tapeinosperma ellipticum, commonly known as the elliptic tapeinosperma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are typically consumed by birds and other wildlife. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
